intro: Pycreus gracillimus, commonly known as the slender pycreus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Due to its restricted habitat and vulnerability to environmental changes, Pycreus gracillimus is considered a species of conservation concern.
